column4: IDE primary slave partition is "UNALLOCATED" i can see this using GPARTED....what should i do? I am not able to use IDE Primary Slave partition ???
if it's unallocated space, then it's not a partition to begin with - it's space allocated to no partition.
: thanx for correcting.
you can most certainly create a partition in it, with the very gparted
: BUT i want use that "unallocated" space
then create a partition.
: it should be extended OR primary ?
depends. you can have up to 4 primary partitions. if you need more than 4, one of them will have to be extended
: i mean if the alloacted space is on IDE Primary Slave ...should i make is Priamry Or Slave ?

for starters, in Linux program files aren't sorted according to which program they belong to - rather, they're sorted according to their purpose. so for example, in /usr/share/doc you'll find the documentation for all programs, in /etc the configuration files...
that's probably not a good idea, but you can put the "nopasswd" options in the sudo config file, which can be edited with "visudo"
man sudoers will give you information and examples. hit "/" and type "nopasswd" to search and highlight
: kindly tell is this the commnd to be run in terminal man sudoers ??
man sudoers, yes. it will give you the instructions on editing the sudoers file
then to actually edit it, it's "sudo EDITOR=nano visudo"
: thats good one.
man update-alternatives will probably give you a clue
man dpkg will tell you

hit Q
